Rails talk overview

23 Mar 2009

Glasgow Greenmap Overview - Joseph 20min

* Other maps
Slide Point: Open people to alternative approaches depending on situations and available skills
Convey: We started with something that was already working and then adapted around the needs of members, php, no solid geo frameworks
Take away: These kind of projects are done the world over, start from a working base, attempt things

* Our approach
Slide Point: We opted to start from scratch after considering limited alternatives. All the projects tools are based on Ruby.
Convey: Built upon available plugins, Built on an unfamiliar framework, build around deliverable features, If you are going to do it you get final say
Take away: If the tools are there use them otherwise go with the easiest option, take on tools as they become available, mitigate all boring stuff outside of meetings, keep momentum,

* Work with desirable tools
Slide point: People want the best in their free time make it a fun learning experience and not a chore
Convey: Started on PHP moved to ruby, tried xplanner but it was too heavy, basecamp is/was cool, Easy development cycle with PHP-like easiness to adopt, VPS, capistrano/webistrano

* A Virtual Meeting place - Basecamp
Slide Point: Keep in touch and make your progress known and felt within the team
Convey: A sense of belonging to a team with pictures of everyone, seeing everyones progress.

* Code out in the open
Slide Point: Encourage people to review and be reviewed
Convey: Google code repo with reviews/changes & mail group for commits code changes, bug tracking, pair programming

* Environment hygiene / process
Slide Point: Give people quick feedback from their changes
Convey: Encourage commits, allow people to show the world their efforts
